title: Algebra I Teacher Instructional Analysis: Realistic Mathematics Education (RME)-Based Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Analyzing actual classroom cases to apply the RME (Realistic Mathematics Education) approach, with a focus on students' self-directed model development.

learning_goals: Three or more principles of lesson design based on Realistic Mathematics Education (RME) theory can be explained
Mathematical potential can be derived by analyzing students' self-construction models
Teachers' decision-making processes in actual classroom cases can be evaluated using the RME framework
Through project-based assessment, learners can design RME (Realistic Mathematics Education) application cases and create presentation materials
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
